comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
Attended W.S. Lee Dover College in Dover
1892— Second Term.
Barker, Ernest Francis William J (2nd July, 1877) [Sch.] ; XV.,
1895 ; left, 1895 (c) ; Sandhurst Entrance, June, 1896 ;
E.M.C., Shooting VIII., 1897 ; Second Lieutenant,
King's Own (Yorkshire) Light Infantry, February,
1898.
Beggar* 8 Bush Barracks, Dublin,
Permanent address. Colonel F. W. J. Barker, B.A.,
St.Elmo, Olton, Birmingham.

The London Gazette, May 4, 1909
The King's Own Yorkshire Light Infantry,
Captain Ernest F W Barker is seconded for service on the Staff. 
Dated 1st April, 1909.

Major E F W Barker survived the War.  The London Gazette of 16 September 1927 states under Appts in India
that he was appointed Commandant, SignalsTraining Centre. Jubbulpore—Col E.F.W. Barker, C.B.E. D.S.O., Brit.Serv., 5th July 1926.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
Ernest Frances William Barker
Birth: abt 1877 - Crosshaven Cork, Ireland
Residence: 2 Apr 1911 - Aldershot, Surrey  (1911 Census)
Ernest F.W. Barker married Enid R. Boyce in Hartley Wintney, Hampshire registered 1st qr 1914.
(Free BMD)
Ernest F.W. Barker died in Kensington registered 4th qr 1961 age 84.
(Free BMD)

Fellow of Royal Commonwealth Society at the time of his death.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Eldest son of Colonel Sir Francis Barker, Folkestone newspapers.nl.sg/Digitised/Article/singfreepressb19140212... Sir Francis Barker donated Sir Francis Barker Recreation Ground, Leatherhead Road in 1920 - home of Chessington Cricket & Sports Club A brother of Ernest F W Barker was Maj Godfrey Barker (born Malta, 13 Jan. 1883) of Royal Marine L.Infantry, Drake Battn., who died April 28/29, 1915 in Gallipoli, 4th son of Col Sir Francis Barker and of Lady Barker of 27 Tite St, Chelsea age 32. www.masonicgreatwarproject.org.uk/writeup.php?string=138
